summary: This is an email chain from October 11, 2019, within the FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit, approving travel for agents to conduct victim briefings and interviews in Florida as part of the ongoing Epstein investigation. It details travel logistics and budget for agents traveling to Miami, West Palm Beach, and Palm Coast.

persons.name: Lenny
persons.context: Addressed in an email requesting travel approval for the Epstein investigation; appears to be the supervisor or approving official for the travel request.

persons.name: Ina
persons.context: Appears as a recipient on the email chain forwarding the travel request for the Epstein victim briefing and interviews.

connections.description: Both are involved in the FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit, with Lenny being the recipient of a travel request that is forwarded to Ina.

events.title: Travel Approval for Epstein Victim Interviews
events.description: The FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit approves travel for agents to conduct a victim briefing in Miami and subsequent victim and witness interviews in Miami, West Palm Beach, and Palm Coast as part of the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit was actively investigating Epstein and conducting victim interviews as of October 2019.
The investigation involved planned travel to multiple Florida locations (Miami, West Palm Beach, Palm Coast) for victim briefings and interviews.
The travel request was for four people initially, with a detailed budget of approximately $6,263.50.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination and approval processes for investigative travel.
The case number referenced for the travel is 31E-NY-3027571.
